required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Target Occupancy Study With Ritlecitinib.
clinical_study.official_title: AN OPEN LABEL, PHASE 1, TWO-ARM STUDY TO ASSESS TARGET OCCUPANCY AND FUNCTIONAL INHIBITION OF JAK3 AND TEC KINASES BY SINGLE DOSES OF RITLECITINIB IN HEALTHY ADULT PARTICIPANTS

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 1, open label, two-arm study to assess target occupancy and functional inhibition of JAK3 and TEC kinases by Ritlecitinib in healthy adult participants

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change from Baseline in Target Occupancy (TO)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose, 1 hr, 4 hr, 8 hr, 24 hr, and 48 hr post dose
primary_outcome.description: Percent Change from Baseline in TO for Janus Kinase 3 (JAK3) and Tyrosine kinase Expressed in hepatocellular Carcinoma (TEC)

secondary_outcome.description: Cmax will be observed directly from data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Ritlecitinib
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax will be observed directly from data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration at 48 hours post-dose (Clast) of Ritlecitinib
secondary_outcome.description: Clast will be observed directly from data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average plasma concentration from time 0 to 24 hrs (Cav) of Ritlecitinib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose, 1 hr, 2 hr, 4 hr, 8 hr, and 24 hr post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Calculated as area under the concentration time curve over the dosing frequency

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to 24 hours (AUC24) of Ritlecitinib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose, 1 hr, 2 hr, 4 hr, 8 hr, 24 hr, and 48 hr post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to 24 hours (dosing frequency)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to the time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUClast) of Ritlecitinib
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose, 1 hr, 2 hr, 4 hr, 8 hr, 24 hr, and 48 hr post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time 0 to the time of the last quantifiable concentration (Clast)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Treatment-Related Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 0) up to 28 days after last dose of study drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Change From Baseline in Laboratory Tests Results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through study completion, approximately 3 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Categorical Vital Signs Data
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through study completion, approximately 3 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Adverse Events by Severity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after last dose

arm_group.description: Subjects will be dosed with 50 mg Ritlecitinib on Day 1 and followed up till Day 3
Subjects will be dosed with 200 mg Ritlecitinib on Day 1 and followed up till Day 3

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Participants are eligible to be included in the study only if all the following criteria apply:
- Participants who are willing and able to comply with all scheduled visits, treatment plan, laboratory tests, lifestyle considerations, and other study procedures.
- Male and female participants who are overtly healthy as determined by medical evaluation including medical history, physical examination including BP and pulse rate measurement, 12-lead ECG, or clinical and laboratory tests.
- BMI of 17.5 to 30.5 kg/m2; and a total body weight >50 kg (110 lb).
Exclusion Criteria:
Participants are excluded from the study if any of the following criteria apply:
- Evidence or history of clinically significant hematological, renal, endocrine, pulmonary, gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, hepatic, psychiatric, neurological, or allergic disease (including drug allergies, but excluding untreated, asymptomatic, seasonal allergies at the time of dosing).
- Infection with hepatitis B or hepatitis C viruses
- Have evidence of untreated or inadequately treated active or latent Mycobacterium TB infection
- Known active or history of recurrent bacterial, viral, fungal, mycobacterial or other infections.
- Have received only one of the 2 required doses of COVID-19 vaccine.
- Participants have a known present or a history of malignancy other than a successfully treated or excised non metastatic basal cell or squamous cell cancer of the skin or cervical carcinoma in situ.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
